body.raw:
{"fields": {"description": "h1. Quick version:

Mark the parent issue as 'In-Progress', mark first sub-task as 'Done'. 

h1. Instructions to Complete:

Start progress on the parent 101 Training AKS ticket.  This issue/ticket, the one you are reading, is a sub-task of the parent ticket. You can navigate back to the parent ticket using the breadcrumb navigation at the top of this sub-task ticket. Breadcrumb navigation will let you quickly navigate from a sub-task to the parent issue (click on image below to see larger image)  

!BreakcrumbLinksIssue.png|thumbnail! 

 

Once the parent has its status set as 'In Progress', you can complete this ticket by marking it as â€˜Doneâ€™.

You should try first, but if you get stuck or if these instructions arenâ€™t clear there is a video capturing these steps: [Complete First Training sub-task|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AKS/pages/375655844/AKS-3%2BHow-To%2BComplete%2BFirst%2BSub-Task%2Bof%2B101%2BTraining] 

Optional bonus: Comment on this issue with something like "I am starting my Atlassian 101 training, and I couldn't be more excited""}}

body.raw:
{"fields": {"description": "h1.Quick version:
Upload a picture to your Atlassian avatar so it is not the default.


h1. Background:

Adding an avatar picture is a small update that can make a big difference. When you are collaborating across your team, the avatar visually indicates who you are collaborating with.  Lets set your profile to a professional/personal head shot of yourself OR  another recognizable avatar photo.


h1. Actions to Complete:

1. Navigate to the lower left hand navigation to the default Jira/Atlassian Avatar:

 !LowerLevelAvatar.png|thumbnail! 

2. Click on Avatar and then "Profile"

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-23 at 1.33.50 PM.png|thumbnail! 

3. Click on the Avatar at the top to upload a new photo

 !ProfilePicUplaod.png|thumbnail! 

4. To complete this training sub-task: attach a screenshot of your new avatar in action. Mark this sub-task as "Done"

h1. Video Guide:

* Use this video if you need help: [Assigning Jira Issues|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AKS/pages/375688352/AKS-14+How+To+Setup+Your+Profile+Picture]"}}

item.name: Description For Create An Issue Directly

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

body.raw:
{"fields": {"description": "h1. Quick version:
Raise a task in Jira (non-service desk) in the AKS Jira project. Find it on the report and update it's status and verify report is updating. 

h1. Summary:
 
Going through the Service Desk is a good way to raise a request to another team.  However, in a lot of cases you will want to use Jira to create issue directly.  For instance, if you want to create tracking issues in your team's Jira to track work, creating issues in Jira is the likely method. We'll practice this as a separate case.

We will find our Jira issue on a report and update it.  We will then see how the report updates.

As a final step we will link the newly created issue to this issue.


h1. Actions to Complete:
h2. Lets Create the Jira Issue
# Go to this link [AKS Jira Activity|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/projects/AKS/summary] (right click for new tab)
# Click the (plus) + in the most left navigation, 4 down (this starts a Jira issue creation)
# Create an Issue populated with the following info, similar to screen below. Except assign to yourself.

 !JiraIssueCreation.png|thumbnail! 

{color:#d04437}*MAKE SURE:*{color} that you:
*  label  *101-Training* is
*  Assignee is Yourself

See [this video|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AKS/pages/383255707/AKS-21+101+Jira+Issue+Creation+and+Report+Training] if you get stuck

h2. Let's Find Our Task on A Report:
# Your new task issue should be found on the [101 Tasks Training Report|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AKS/pages/383222883/AKS-17+Training+Task+Report]

See [this video|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AKS/pages/383255707/AKS-21+101+Jira+Issue+Creation+and+Report+Training]  if you get stuck

h2. Let's open our Task, Mark it as Done, and view it on report.
# Right click on the link to your task
# Go to Task issue screen
# Click on "Done" to mark as "Done"
# Refresh the report to verify update
# Take note of your issue key (AKS-####), we will need it for the next step
 
See [this video|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AKS/pages/383255707/AKS-21+101+Jira+Issue+Creation+and+Report+Training] if you get stuck

h2. Let's practice issue linking. 
It is helpful to link issues. We can practice this from this issue
# Let's link it from this issue by navigation to the top right 3 dotter (...). Click on link issues and link your issue
# Select link type as "relates to"
# Search for the task issue key you created
# You can verify that the link exists on _this_ issue

See [this video|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AKS/pages/383353845/AKS-22+101+Training+Linking+an+Issue] if you get stuck

Once your new task, marked to Done, is linked to this issue, you can mark this sub-task as Done."}}
